page.title: 08Horton Hall - Manor house.
page.content: Horton Hall is an old building,built 150 years ago.It has been owned by a school,hospital,families and a person called Violet Needham.In the Second World War Messerschmitt 109's shot down a Whitney bomber which just missed crashing into the Hall.The house which is an early Victorian design was probably built for a rich man.The estate agents in 1885 said it had 1500 acres but now it only has a few acres.The Hall is now owned by PAFEC,a company which makes computer programmes for testing structures on buildings.The company employ a small number of people,all from outside the area,apart from the managing director who lives there.The Hall is made of Bath stone and blends in well with the surrounding area.Much of it has been rebuilt recently as the stonework has been crumbling.
